sen.j: 松井 友閑（まつい ゆうかん）は安土桃山時代（戦国時代 (日本)）の文官。
sen.e: Yukan MATSUI was a civil officer in the Azuchi-Momoyama period (the period of warring states in Japan).
Yukan MATSUI was a civil officer in the Azuchi-Momoyama period (the period of warring states in Japan).

sen.j: 出身地については諸説ある。
sen.e: His place of birth has been variously explained.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: His place of birth has been variously given.
sen.cmt: explained を given に修正しました。
sen.e: His place of birth has been variously given.

sen.j: 信長公記の記載より尾張国清洲の町人出身と推定されている。
sen.e: It has been assumed that he was of the merchant class in Kiyosu, Owari Province according to a description in the Shincho-ko Koki ("The Biography of Nobunaga ODA").

sen.e: It has been assumed that he was of the merchant class in Kiyosu, Owari Province according to a description in the "Shincho-ko Koki" (The Biography of Nobunaga ODA).

sen.j: しかしルイス・フロイスは友閑のことを「以前に仏僧であり」と記しており、出自に謎は残る。
sen.e: Luis FROIS, on the other hand, mentioned that he had been previously a Buddhist monk, thus making his origin an enigma.
Luis FROIS, on the other hand, mentioned that he had been previously a Buddhist priest, thus mystery still hangs over his origin.

sen.j: 永禄11年（1568年）の織田信長入京後には京畿の政務にあたり、織田家の右筆に任じられている。
sen.e: After Nobunaga ODA entered Kyoto in 1568, Yukan was in charge of government affairs in Keiki (the area around Kyoto), appointed as 'Yuhitsu' (amanuensis) of the Oda family.

sen.j: 京都や堺市の豪商らに接触して名物の茶器などを供出させた。
sen.e: Approaching wealthy merchants in Kyoto and Sakai City, he urged them to provide noted tea utensils.

sen.j: 天正3年（1575年）には堺の代官に任じられた。
sen.e: He was appointed 'daikan' (regional officer) of Sakai in 1575.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処

sen.j: この頃になると堺の豪商・津田宗及とも親交を深めた。
sen.e: Around this time he became friendly with Sogyu TSUDA, a wealthy merchant in Sakai.
Around this time he deepened friendship with Sogyu TSUDA, a wealthy merchant in Sakai.

sen.j: 織田家では主に財務などを担当したが外交能力にも長け、本願寺との和睦工作にも奔走している。
sen.e: Mainly in charge of financial affairs in the Oda family, he was also a talented diplomat, seeking to make peace with Hongan-ji Temple.

sen.j: 本能寺の変後は豊臣秀吉に接近し、堺の代官として以後も活躍する。
sen.e: Approaching Hideyoshi TOYOTOMI after the Honnoji Incident, he later flourished as daikan in Sakai.
Approaching Hideyoshi TOYOTOMI after the Honnoji Incident, he later flourished as daikan (governor) of Sakai.

sen.e: Approaching Hideyoshi TOYOTOMI after the Honnoji Incident, he later flourished as daikan (governor) of Sakai.

sen.j: しかし天正14年（1586年）に突然罷免され、その後の消息は不明である。
sen.e: In 1586, however, he was suddenly dismissed, and we do not know what happened to him afterwards.
